# hitachi_vsp_one_volume_qos (Resource)

Manage volume QoS settings in VSP One storage.

## Example Usage

```terraform
#
# Manage QoS settings for a Hitachi VSP One Volume
#
# This example demonstrates how to configure QoS (Quality of Service) settings
# for a specific volume in a Hitachi storage system using the
# "hitachi_vsp_one_volume_qos" resource.
#
# Adjust the parameters (such as serial, volume_id, threshold and alert_setting) to match your environment.
#

resource "hitachi_vsp_one_volume_qos" "example" {
  serial    = 12345
  volume_id = 678
  threshold {
    is_upper_iops_enabled          = true
    upper_iops                     = 3000
    is_upper_transfer_rate_enabled = true
    upper_transfer_rate            = 200
    is_lower_iops_enabled          = true
    lower_iops                     = 1000
    is_lower_transfer_rate_enabled = true
    lower_transfer_rate            = 50
    is_response_priority_enabled   = true
    response_priority              = 3
  }
  alert_setting {
    is_upper_alert_enabled        = true
    upper_alert_allowable_time    = 60
    is_lower_alert_enabled        = false
    lower_alert_allowable_time    = 0
    is_response_alert_enabled     = true
    response_alert_allowable_time = 30
  }
}

output "volume_qos_info" {
  value = hitachi_vsp_one_volume_qos.example
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `serial` (Number) Serial number of the storage system.
- `volume_id` (Number) Volume ID.

### Optional

- `alert_setting` (Block List) Alert settings for the volume. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--alert_setting))
- `threshold` (Block List) Threshold settings for the volume. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--threshold))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedblock--alert_setting"></a>
### Nested Schema for `alert_setting`

Optional:

- `is_lower_alert_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable alert setting for not reaching lower IOPS or data transfer rate.
- `is_response_alert_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable alert setting when response time target is not met.
- `is_upper_alert_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable alert setting for exceeding upper IOPS or data transfer rate.
- `lower_alert_allowable_time` (Number) Permissible duration (s) for not reaching lower IOPS or data transfer rate. Required if is_lower_alert_enabled is true.
- `response_alert_allowable_time` (Number) Permissible duration (s) when response time target is not met. Required if is_response_alert_enabled is true.
- `upper_alert_allowable_time` (Number) Permissible duration (s) when upper IOPS or data transfer rate is exceeded. Required if is_upper_alert_enabled is true.


<a id="nestedblock--threshold"></a>
### Nested Schema for `threshold`

Optional:

- `is_lower_iops_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable lower IOPS setting.
- `is_lower_transfer_rate_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable lower data transfer rate setting.
- `is_response_priority_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable I/O processing priority.
- `is_upper_iops_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable upper IOPS setting.
- `is_upper_transfer_rate_enabled` (Boolean) Enable/disable upper data transfer rate setting.
- `lower_iops` (Number) Lower IOPS target value. Required if is_lower_iops_enabled is true.
- `lower_transfer_rate` (Number) Lower data transfer rate target value (MiBps). Required if is_lower_transfer_rate_enabled is true.
- `response_priority` (Number) I/O processing priority. The smaller the value, the lower the priority; the larger the value, the higher the priority. Required if is_response_priority_enabled is true.
- `upper_iops` (Number) Upper IOPS value. Required if is_upper_iops_enabled is true.
- `upper_transfer_rate` (Number) Upper data transfer rate value (MiBps). Required if is_upper_transfer_rate_enabled is true.
